remarks: If ` G ` and ` H ` are path-homotopic, then their lifts ` M ` and ` N ` are also path-homotopic.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jul-2015.)
statement:
cvmliftpht.b $e |- B = U. C $.
cvmliftpht.m $e |- M = ( iota_ f e. ( II Cn C ) ( ( F o. f ) = G /\ ( f ` 0 ) = P ) ) $.
cvmliftpht.n $e |- N = ( iota_ f e. ( II Cn C ) ( ( F o. f ) = H /\ ( f ` 0 ) = P ) ) $.
cvmliftpht.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C CovMap J ) ) $.
cvmliftpht.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. B ) $.
cvmliftpht.e $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` P ) = ( G ` 0 ) ) $.
cvmliftpht.g $e |- ( ph -> G ( ~=ph ` J ) H ) $.
cvmliftpht $p |- ( ph -> M ( ~=ph ` C ) N ) $.
